api
Interface Task<T>

All Known Implementing Classes:
FibonacciTask, MandelbrotSetTask, TaskBase, TspTask
public interface Task<T>

Models any task that can be executed on a remote machine using Divide and conquer algorithm. Every task in the Divide and Conquer tree is identified by an ID. The parent of each task is identified by a parentID.

Author:
Manasa Chandrasekhar, Kowshik Prakasam

Nested Class Summary
static class Task.Status
          Enum to describe the status of the task during the Divide and the Conquer phase.

Method Detail

decompose

Result<T> decompose()
This method models the 'Divide' phase of the Divide and conquer algorithm. Any subclass implementing this method should divide the existing task into smaller subtasks, pack the subtasks in a Result object and return them. The returned subtasks are consumed by a Space object by queueing them again for execution on different machine in the cluster. If the base case of recursion has been reached during the process of decomposition, then the value can be returned in the Result object, instead of subtasks.

Returns:
A Result object containing either subtasks that have been created during this decomposition stage, or value of a base case in the underlying recursion

compose

Result<T> compose(java.util.List<?> list)
This method models the 'Conquer' phase of the Divide and conquer algorithm. Any subclass implementing this method should compose results of smaller subtasks (passed as a parameter) that were earlier generated by this task during the 'Divide' phase, into a single value that can be consumed by the parent of this task in the overall recursion tree.

Parameters:
list - A java.util.List containing results obtained from the smaller subtasks that were originally generated by the same task
Returns:
A Result object containing a value obtained by composing results of smaller subtasks that were generated by this task in the 'Divide' phase

getStatus

Task.Status getStatus()
Returns:
Returns the status of this task

setStatus

void setStatus(Task.Status s)
Sets the status of this task. This method can be used by a Space object to switch the status of a subtask after the from DECOMPOSE (after the 'Divide' phase) into COMPOSE (to start the 'Conquer' phase).

getParentId

java.lang.String getParentId()
Returns:
ID of the parent task in the recursion tree

setParentId

void setParentId(java.lang.String id)
Sets the ID of the parent task in the recursion tree

java.lang.String getId()
Returns:
Unique ID representing this task in the recursion tree

setId

void setId(java.lang.String taskId)
Sets a unique ID representing this task in the recursion tree

getDecompositionSize

int getDecompositionSize()
Returns:
Number of smaller subtasks generated by this task at the end of the DECOMPOSE ('Divide') phase.

getChildIds

java.util.List<java.lang.String> getChildIds()
Returns:
Unique IDs of all child tasks generated by this task at the end of the DECOMPOSE ('Divide') phase
